ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Marriage question......
ygData.msgSnippet: Sometimes you ll see things like this Fnord auctions, WTS banded boots PST That means Fnord has used the auction command to send a message to the entire
ygData.messageBody:
Sometimes you'll see things like this


Fnord auctions, "WTS banded boots PST"

That means Fnord has used the auction command to send a message to the
entire zone. The message can be translated as "Want to sell (WTS) banded
boots, please send a tell (PST) if you're interested".

Similarly to auction, people can use shout to shout to the entire zone, or
ooc to speak "out of character" to the entire zone.

The intention for the use of these channels is:

shout - your character wants to shout loud enough that people not near
them will still be able to hear them, the intention is that you use this
"in character" speaking as if you were your character. For example "watch
out, there is a sand giant near the beach".

ooc - speaking out of character, this is you speaking as yourself. For
example, "Does anyone know what level rangers get double attack at?"

auction - this is reserved for selling items, and inquiring about buying
items.

Another usefull command is /yell, or /y. This will cause people near you
to get a message like "Brangvyne yells for help from your left". Sometimes
it's hard to find someone, and having them /yell will let you know where
they are (if you're close enough to hear the yell).

- Christina
